title: ‘The Nvidia Way’ review: The hard work of tech mastery | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
‘The Nvidia Way’ review: The hard work of tech mastery

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Company Business News

The origin story of Nvidia is starkly contrasted with other tech legends, revealing a unique journey from humble beginnings to a tech powerhouse. The stock price of Nvidia has seen remarkable growth, indicating its importance and influence in the tech industry.

  • Nvidia started in a San Jose Denny's in 1992 with three founders brainstorming over coffee.
  • The company's stock has increased from around $6 in January 2020 to nearly $140 today.

MobiKwik IPO allotment status check online: Applied for shares? Got or not?

Updated: Dec 16, 2024 | Source: ET Now

The MobiKwik IPO has experienced significant interest, achieving a subscription rate of 119.38 times as the offer concluded, with a high level of participation from various investor categories.

  • The initial public offer (IPO) of MobiKwik raised Rs 572 crore.
  • It received bids for over 1.41 billion shares, significantly above the 118.71 million shares on offer.
  • The allotment date is expected on December 16, 2024.
  • Investors can check their allotment status via NSE, BSE, and LinkIntime websites.
  • The company has set a share price band of Rs 265-279.
  • This IPO marks MobiKwik's second attempt after its initial plans in 2021 were shelved.

MobiKwik's IPO signifies a critical moment for the company, aiming for a successful market entry after overcoming previous hurdles.

title: YouTuber slams ‘filthy’ Air India business class flight for ‘miserable’ nine-hour experience - Hindustan Times
summary:
YouTuber Criticizes Air India's 'Filthy' Business Class Experience

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A travel influencer, Drew Binsky, criticized Air India for a disastrous business class flight experience that he labeled the worst of his life.

  • Binsky traveled from London to Amritsar, paying $750 for the business class upgrade.
  • He faced issues such as a broken seat, cramped space, and a dirty meal setting.
  • The in-flight entertainment was outdated, and WiFi connectivity was poor.
  • He found the amenities lacking, comparing them to those of a one-star motel.
  • Despite the complaints, Air India has not yet responded to his criticisms.
“Thank you Air India for this miserable nine-hour experience which I spent $750 to upgrade for.”

This incident highlights ongoing concerns about airline service quality, especially in premium offerings, and emphasizes the need for airlines to maintain standards.
newTitle: YouTuber Criticizes Air India's 'Filthy' Business Class Experience

Delhi High Court summons SpiceJet CEO, COO over non-payment of $6 million to lessors - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Delhi High Court Summons SpiceJet Executives Over $6 Million Payment Issue

Published on: 16 Dec 2024, 11:26 am

The Delhi High Court has summoned the CEO and COO of SpiceJet to appear in court over a non-payment of $6.03 million due to lessors. The court specified that video conferencing was not an option for their appearance.

  • The court directed SpiceJet executives to appear on January 16, 2025.
  • Engine lessors have initiated legal action against SpiceJet for non-payment.
  • SpiceJet defaulted on a prior agreement to pay $4.8 million in installments.
  • The court has ordered SpiceJet to ground three engines and return them to lessors.
"It is made clear that the request of the counsel for Judgement Debtor (SpiceJet) for appearance of the aforesaid officers through Video Conferencing has been specifically denied."

This order emphasizes the seriousness of SpiceJet's financial issues and its obligations to the lessors as it faces multiple legal challenges.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Summons SpiceJet Executives Over $6 Million Payment Issue

title: India’s imports rise to 27%, touches to record high of almost $70 billion - The Hindu
summary:
India’s Imports Hit Record High of $70 Billion in November

Date: December 16, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

India's merchandise exports have declined while imports surged, leading to a significant trade deficit.

  • Imports rose 27% to $70 billion, a record high.
  • Exports fell 4.83% to $32.11 billion.
  • The trade deficit reached an all-time high of $37.84 billion.
  • Non-petroleum exports rose by 7.8%, touching $28.4 billion.
  • Petroleum exports dropped about 49% due to falling prices.
“Non-petroleum exports have grown at a comfortable pace and that is what we should be looking at,” - Commerce Secretary Sunil Barthwal.

The growing trend in imports and the significant trade deficit reflect the current economic challenges India is facing.
newTitle: India’s Imports Reach Record High of $70 Billion in November

Supreme Court moots transfer of Amazon, Flipkart cases to Karnataka High Court on CCI's plea - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court moots transfer of Amazon, Flipkart cases to Karnataka High Court on CCI's plea

Published on: 16 Dec 2024, 9:51 am

The Supreme Court has expressed its preliminary view that all ongoing cases against Amazon and Flipkart for anti-competitive practices should be consolidated and transferred to the Karnataka High Court.

  • The Supreme Court observed that all related cases currently pending in various High Courts should ideally be transferred to Karnataka.
  • A hearing for the case in Karnataka High Court is scheduled for December 17.
  • The court has ordered that no further proceedings should occur in the Karnataka High Court until a decision is made on January 6.
  • The Competition Commission of India filed a transfer plea urging consolidation of 24 pending writ petitions against the e-commerce giants.
  • These cases were originally filed by the Delhi Vyapar Sangh, highlighting alleged violations of the Competition Act, 2002.
  • Concerns were raised regarding the absence of some parties in the proceedings, and there are now 26 petitions related to the issue.
“Parties which are represented today take notice. We permit petitioner to add parties. Amended cause title shall be filed in two days.”

The case has significant implications for competition law enforcement in India and may streamline adjudications concerning e-commerce operations.
newTitle: Supreme Court Considers Transferring Amazon and Flipkart Cases to Karnataka High Court

title: GMP soars! Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO - Major jump! Allotment date and time, listing date, share price prediction - ET Now
summary:
Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO Soars with Major Updates

Updated: December 16, 2024 15:47 IST

The Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO has significant developments as its public subscription period ends, with a robust grey market premium indicating strong investor interest.

  • The IPO is an Offer For Sale of 1.88 crore equity shares by promoters and shareholders.
  • Allotment of shares is expected to occur on December 17.
  • Refunds for unsuccessful applicants will start on December 18.
  • The grey market premium is currently at Rs 417, suggesting a strong listing gain.
  • The estimated listing price is Rs 1746, indicating a potential gain of 31.38% for investors.
  • The IPO will not generate funds for the company as it is purely an OFS.
"The company's IPO is entirely an Offer For Sale (OFS)... Its market capitalization is over Rs 22,800 crore."

This IPO is poised to enhance the company's visibility and provide liquidity to its shareholders, potentially impacting the healthcare solutions market significantly.
newTitle: Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO Soars with Major Updates

summary:
Mobikwik IPO Allotment Today: Check GMP, Listing Status And Other Details

Date: December 16, 2024 Source: ABP Live

The final allotment of the Mobikwik maiden offer will be completed today, allowing investors to find out the status of their applications. The IPO was highly subscribed and is set to debut in the stock market soon.

  • The IPO was open for subscription from December 11-13, 2024.
  • Priced between Rs 265 to Rs 279 with a minimum lot size of 53 shares.
  • Oversubscribed 119.38 times overall.
  • Retail investors subscribed 134.67 times, while QIBs subscribed 119.50 times and NIIs subscribed 108.95 times.
  • Shares are trading at a grey market premium of 59.14%, around Rs 444.
  • Mobikwik has over 161 million users and a merchant network of 4.26 million as of June 2024.
“Grey market premium represents investors' confidence regarding the upcoming listing.”

Investors can check the allotment status on the official exchanges or the issue’s registrar, Link Intime India.
newTitle: Mobikwik IPO Allotment Today: Check GMP, Listing Status And Other Details

Google names its new India chief - TechCrunch
summary:
Google Appoints Preeti Lobana as New India Chief

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: TechCrunch

Google has appointed Preeti Lobana to lead its India business, filling a key position left vacant since July.

  • Preeti Lobana previously served as VP of Advertising Technology at Google.
  • India is a crucial market for Google, which has invested billions to enhance digital access.
  • Google has faced regulatory scrutiny in India, including fines totaling $275 million in recent years.
  • Roma Datta Chobey, interim chief, will return to manage Google’s digital business unit.
  • Lobana emphasized the importance of AI in shaping future business opportunities.
“This is a once-in-a-lifetime moment to shape the future with AI, unlocking unprecedented opportunities for businesses to boost productivity.”

In conclusion, Preeti Lobana’s appointment comes at a time of great challenge and opportunity for Google in India.
newTitle: Google Appoints Preeti Lobana as New India Chief

LG Electronics India IPO: Firm eyes up to $15 billion valuation; check other latest buzz - Upstox
summary:
LG Electronics India Plans IPO with Target Valuation of $15 Billion

Publication Date: December 16, 2023
Source: Bloomberg

LG Electronics is set to list its Indian arm on domestic stock exchanges, aiming for a valuation of up to $15 billion. The company filed a draft red herring prospectus earlier this month.

  • LG plans to sell up to 101.82 million shares, with no new shares issued.
  • Post-offer shareholding will dilute by 15% to 57.69 crore shares.
  • The listing is expected to enhance visibility and provide liquidity for its shares.
  • LG Electronics India is a leading player in home appliances and consumer electronics.
  • The merchant bankers involved include Morgan Stanley and JP Morgan.
  • This IPO marks LG Electronics as the second Korean chaebol listing in India after Hyundai Motors.
  • Current market valuation of LG in Seoul stands at $10 billion after a 13% share drop this year.
  • Strong sales interest has been noted from global investors, with an earlier valuation around $13 billion reported in September.
“The listing of equity shares will enhance visibility and brand image.”
newTitle: LG Electronics India Plans IPO with Target Valuation of $15 Billion
